column4: How do I change my trackpad sensitivity in an Ubuntu Live CD?  Using System -> Preferences -> Mouse doesn't work.
Anyone using Ubuntu on a laptop?
me
How do you change the sensitivity?
one sec
i'm looking through that
Thanks.
system -> preferences -> mouse -> motion tab and try tinkering with all sliders?
Yeah, I've tried that, but it seems to make no difference (or perhaps very little difference).
probably cause you're on the live cd
Ah.
things get to go real slow on the live cd and some variables may not adjust immediately. or ever :\
Acknowledged.
maybe keyboard issues? could be that the live cd detected a wrong keyboard
the ubuntu desktop on thoust hard disketh itself will bloweth thou away
how are you able to put the slashes here on IRC though?!
I mean ubuntu installed on a hard disk
Yeah.  It probably would blow me away.
aaah
they look perfect on my laptop straight away
Were you able to make them look better?
Oh, scratch that.  Thought you said 'imperfect'.
i didn't need to. They weren't blurry at all
